attributes.action: Change the date of  the start of British Summer Time to the 1st weekend in March
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
In the USA, the change to Daylight Saving Time was on Sunday the 8th of March this year. We in the UK have to endure a further 3 weeks of miserable short evenings with early darkness, before the clocks change to British Summer Time (BST) at the end of March.

The current date changes to BST are illogical, because the change to GMT is less than two months before the Winter Solstice, but we have to wait for over three months afterwards for the change back to BST. By early March the sunrise is early enough to allow most people to go to work or school in daylight.

Advantages of the change would include more time to indulge in outdoors activitivies after a normal working day, leading to improved fitness and a greater feeling of well-being. It would also keep us in line with the USA system.
